posts.title: Help Sharavan Take care Of 200+ Injured And Abandoned
posts.name: By Sharavan
posts.desc: Shravan Krishnan helps in running an NGO called The Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary. It was started by the Theosophical Society on the 15th of July 2000. It is a rescue shelter for injured and abandoned animals. Shravan Krishnan is a 29-year-old young man who is an animal lover since his childhood, he has been rescuing injured dogs, cats, horses and birds for years.

posts.title: My Little Boy's Cancer Has Relapsed Twice But I'm Helpless. Please Save Him
posts.name: By Family Friends
posts.desc: My son has been fighting for his life since he was a 5-year-old. Now years later, he is still fighting. However, the cancer seems to take more and more control of his body.I can’t help but think, will God spare my child this time or will cancer actually take him away from me?

posts.title: My 20-YO Son, An Aspiring Doctor, Is Dying Of Aplastic Anemia & Needs Urgent Bone Marrow Transplant. Please Help.
posts.name: By Mansi Singh
posts.desc: I am raising funds for my cousin, Anant Veer Chand, on behalf of his mother. He is suffering from Aplastic Anaemia. It is a disease in which the body fails to produce blood cells in sufficient numbers. He needs to undergo an urgent Bone marrow transplant to survive.

posts.title: A Message To All From Mrs Hemali B Prasad, Wife Of The Brave Warrior, Times Hero ,Late Dr.Balaji Prasad
posts.name: By Mrs. Nitu Singh
posts.desc: Hello all , I am really thankful for all your prayers for my hubby Dr. Balaji Prasad, unfortunately God had other plans ,he thought he needed him more than us , I accept all condolences he is with us forever and ever My journey with my Soulmate.....Very proud of you my love and very blessed to b your wife, you r such a wonderful person you will be in my heart forever, from the first  day of your illness you have always thought about me and kids, so you asked your doctor friend not to tell me how critical you were ,that particular moment you needed my moral support but you thought about me that I will become panicked , who else can love me and care for me more than this, the journey from that day to the day you left me , not a single day you showed your pain, didn’t complain anything , you were always worried about my mental status. Being a doctor you were knowing exactly what you are going through and what can be an outcome, but you were very calm ,not showing any of your worries to me , doctors from both the hospitals were all praised for you , you r my true hero, warrior, soulmate and I love you so much for being with me and now onwards also you r always in my heart ......love you forever and ever

posts.title: Wife Fears She Will Lose The Father Of Their 2-Year-Old Daughter To Brain Haemorrhage. Please Help.
posts.name: By Rachit Shrivastava
posts.desc: My friend Rohit Sharma is suffering from brain haemorrhage and without urgent treatment, he will not survive. Rohit is a doting husband and a loving father to a 2-year-old baby girl. 5 years ago, his father met with a horrible accident which left him paralysed and also caused memory loss. While their family was still processing the devastation, Rohit had suffered from a stroke. On 24 February 2020, Rohit suddenly collapsed and was rushed to the hospital. The doctor told his wife that he suffered from brain haemorrhage because of which he will have to be admitted to the hospital. He also told her that Rohit’s condition was critical and that he will have to stay in the hospital for a long time for treatment & recovery. Rohit is the sole earner of his family and unfortunately, he cannot afford to pay for his own treatment. They need Rs 50 Lakh more and you are their only hope.Please find it in your heart to pay however much you can for Rohit’s life-saving treatment so he can go back home healthy & happy.

posts.title: #PromiseWalaDabba
posts.name: By HDFC Life
posts.desc: This pandemic and the lockdown have seen millions and millions of hardworking workers go out of employment. Among them are the proud Dabbawalas of Mumbai - the pride of our city. Once the deliverers of piping hot, homemade food to thousands of people across town, this century-old community, like many others, is now struggling to make ends meet with the shutdown of offices as well as local railway services in the city.Even in the harshest of conditions, our Dabbawalas have never wavered from their responsibility, delivering Dabbas timely to over 2 lakh customers every day in Mumbai. It is now time for us to fulfill our responsibility and help them stand on their feet once again.

posts.title: Schooling Special Needs Children With Custom Education
posts.name: By Nithilyam Spastic Children Welfare Trust
posts.desc: Children with special needs seldom graduate in India. And this is not entirely because of their inability to cope with high school and college. Our educational system uses standardized methods that are ineffective in imparting knowledge and evaluating skills of differentially abled learners.As a nonprofit residential school committed to recognizing talent and skills among special needs students, we place the greatest emphasis on personalised instruction. Coupled with the great level of attention, care and support in a safe and secure environment, our children not just thrive but blossom.The confidence that we help them gain contributes to making them feel independent to live a full life in college and in their workplace. There is an untapped pool of future artists, entrepreneurs, innovators and leaders in this community.
